Sentencas: Sensitivity analysis and design optimization of solid oxide fuel cells are presented.
Titulo: Adjoint-Based Sensitivity Analysis and Error Correction Methods Applied to Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Multispecies diffusion, low speed convection, and chemical kinetics are included in a two-dimensional numerical model, and sensitivity derivatives are computed using both discrete adjoint method and direct differentiation.
Titulo: Adjoint-Based Sensitivity Analysis and Error Correction Methods Applied to Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The implementation of the discrete adjoint method is validated by comparing sensitivity derivatives obtained using the adjoint with results obtained using direct differentiation and finite-difference methods.
Titulo: Adjoint-Based Sensitivity Analysis and Error Correction Methods Applied to Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: For optimization, cost functions describing hydrogen concentration along the anode-electrolyte interface, hydrogen concentration at the channel outlet, and standard deviation of temperature inside the anode are considered.
Titulo: Adjoint-Based Sensitivity Analysis and Error Correction Methods Applied to Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Material properties of the anode, operating conditions, and a shape parameter are selected as design variables.
Titulo: Adjoint-Based Sensitivity Analysis and Error Correction Methods Applied to Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The development of an initial design environment to automate the flowfield solution, sensitivity computation, optimization, and mesh movement is also described.
Titulo: Adjoint-Based Sensitivity Analysis and Error Correction Methods Applied to Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Finally, an adjoint-based error correction method is implemented and demonstrated to provide accurate estimations for a desired objective function on a fine mesh by combining information obtained from analysis and adjoint solutions on a coarser one.
Titulo: Adjoint-Based Sensitivity Analysis and Error Correction Methods Applied to Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
